Class Calculator

java.lang.Object
com.csaba79coder.calculator.model.Calculator
public class Calculator extends Object
Advanced Calculator model class with comprehensive calculation logic. This class demonstrates professional software design: ✅ BigDecimal for precise decimal calculations (10 decimal places) ✅ Memory functions for storing and recalling values ✅ Calculation history tracking (up to 50 entries) ✅ Basic operations (add, subtract, multiply, divide) ✅ Scientific operations (sin, cos, tan, sqrt, power, log) ✅ Error handling and validation ✅ Clean code with comprehensive documentation
Version:
1.0
Author:
Csaba79coder

  • Field Details

    • displayString

      private String displayString
      Current value being displayed (as string for proper decimal handling). Keeps the decimal point visible even before entering digits after it.

    • currentValue

      private BigDecimal currentValue
      Parsed BigDecimal value for calculations. Updated from displayString when needed for operations.

    • storedValue

      private BigDecimal storedValue
      Value stored when an operation is selected (e.g., after pressing +).

    • currentOperation

      private Operation currentOperation
      The current operation to be performed (null if no operation selected).

    • startNewNumber

      private boolean startNewNumber
      Flag indicating whether to start a new number on next digit input.

    • memoryValue

      private BigDecimal memoryValue
      Memory storage for M+, M-, MR, MC calculator functions. Allows users to store a value and recall it later.

    • calculationHistory

      private List<String> calculationHistory
      List storing previous calculations for user reference. Format: "5 + 3 = 8"

    • MAX_HISTORY_SIZE

      private static final int MAX_HISTORY_SIZE
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • PRECISION

      private static final int PRECISION
      Precision for all BigDecimal operations.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ROUNDING_MODE

      private static final RoundingMode ROUNDING_MODE
      Rounding mode for division operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • Calculator

      public Calculator()
      Constructor - Initializes calculator with default values. Sets all values to zero and prepares for first input.

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the calculator to initial state. Clears current calculation but preserves memory and history. Called when user presses C (Clear) button.

    • fullReset

      public void fullReset()
      Complete reset including memory and history. Called for full calculator reset.

    • appendDigit

      public void appendDigit(String digit)
      Appends a digit to the current number. If starting a new number, replaces current value. Otherwise, concatenates the digit to existing value. Example: - Current: "5", append "3" → "53" - After operation, append "3" → "3" (new number)
      Parameters:
      digit - The digit to append (0-9)

    • appendDecimalPoint

      public void appendDecimalPoint()
      Adds a decimal point to the current number. Only adds if decimal point doesn't already exist. If starting new number, begins with "0." Example: - Current: "5", add decimal → "5." - Current: "5.2", add decimal → "5.2" (no change)

    • updateCurrentValue

      private void updateCurrentValue()
      Updates currentValue from displayString. Parses the string to BigDecimal, handling trailing decimal points.

    • setOperation

      public void setOperation(Operation operation)
      Sets the operation to be performed. If there's a pending operation, calculates it first (chaining). Stores current value for the operation. Example chaining: - Input: 5 + 3 + → Calculates 5+3=8, stores 8, waits for next number
      Parameters:
      operation - The operation to perform (ADD, SUBTRACT, etc.)

    • calculateResult

      public BigDecimal calculateResult()
      Calculates and returns the result of the current operation. Performs the operation between storedValue and currentValue. Adds result to calculation history. Operations: - ADD: storedValue + currentValue - SUBTRACT: storedValue - currentValue - MULTIPLY: storedValue × currentValue - DIVIDE: storedValue ÷ currentValue (with zero check)
      Returns:
      The calculation result
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if dividing by zero

    • performScientificOperation

      public BigDecimal performScientificOperation(ScientificOperation operation)
      Performs scientific operation on the current value. Uses Math library for trigonometric and logarithmic functions.
      Parameters:
      operation - The scientific operation to perform
      Returns:
      The result of the operation
      Throws:
      ArithmeticException - if operation is invalid (e.g., sqrt of negative)

    • calculatePower

      public BigDecimal calculatePower(BigDecimal exponent)
      Calculates power: currentValue ^ exponent.
      Parameters:
      exponent - The power to raise to
      Returns:
      Result of the power operation

    • toggleSign

      public void toggleSign()
      Changes the sign of the current number (positive ↔ negative). Example: 5 → -5, -3.14 → 3.14

    • calculatePercentage

      public void calculatePercentage()
      Converts current number to percentage (divides by 100). Example: 50 → 0.5, 125 → 1.25

    • memoryStore

      public void memoryStore()
      Stores current value in memory (Memory Store). Equivalent to pressing MS button on physical calculator.

    • memoryRecall

      public BigDecimal memoryRecall()
      Recalls value from memory (Memory Recall). Equivalent to pressing MR button.
      Returns:
      The value stored in memory

    • memoryAdd

      public void memoryAdd()
      Adds current value to memory (Memory Add). Equivalent to pressing M+ button.

    • memorySubtract

      public void memorySubtract()
      Subtracts current value from memory (Memory Subtract). Equivalent to pressing M- button.

    • memoryClear

      public void memoryClear()
      Clears memory (Memory Clear). Equivalent to pressing MC button.

    • hasMemory

      public boolean hasMemory()
      Checks if memory contains a non-zero value. Used to display memory indicator in UI.
      Returns:
      true if memory is not empty

    • addToHistory

      private void addToHistory(String calculation)
      Adds a calculation to history. Maintains maximum history size by removing oldest entries.
      Parameters:
      calculation - The calculation string to add

    • getHistory

      public List<String> getHistory()
      Gets the calculation history.
      Returns:
      List of previous calculations, most recent first

    • clearHistory

      public void clearHistory()
      Clears all calculation history.

    • getDisplayValue

      public String getDisplayValue()
      Gets the current display value as a formatted string. Returns the display string which preserves decimal points during input.
      Returns:
      Formatted string for display

    • formatHistory

      private String formatHistory(BigDecimal operand1, String operator, BigDecimal operand2, BigDecimal result)
      Formats a history entry for display.
      Parameters:
      operand1 - First operand
      operator - Operation symbol
      operand2 - Second operand
      result - Result of operation
      Returns:
      Formatted string like "5 + 3 = 8"

    • formatValue

      private String formatValue(BigDecimal value)
      Formats a BigDecimal value for display. Removes unnecessary trailing zeros and decimal points.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to format
      Returns:
      Formatted string

    • getCurrentValue

      public BigDecimal getCurrentValue()
      Gets the current value as BigDecimal. Updates from display string before returning.
      Returns:
      Current calculator value

    • setCurrentValue

      public void setCurrentValue(BigDecimal value)
      Sets the current value directly. Used for special operations or direct value input.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to set

    • isStartNewNumber

      public boolean isStartNewNumber()
      Checks if calculator is ready to start a new number.
      Returns:
      true if next digit starts a new number

    • getCurrentOperation

      public Operation getCurrentOperation()
      Gets the current operation.
      Returns:
      Current operation or null if none

    • getMemoryValue

      public BigDecimal getMemoryValue()
      Gets the memory value.
      Returns:
      Value stored in memory
